intro: Trollius altissimus, commonly known as the tall globeflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its showy, yellow, globe-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and prefers full sun. Trollius altissimus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and alpine settings.
